column4: i think internet sharing doesnt work because ubuntu doesnt even recognize my ethernet.. what do i do? god..
yeah og01
under wired networks i never see anything even when i enable internet sharing
i'm sharing this computer's connection to another one and i use wifi here.. but i want to share it with ethernet..
is this computer hooked "directly" to the internet?
yes, through wifi
it's probably better to get a wifi adapter for the other station..
wifi is not a direct internet connection...
i'm not sure if the tools support wifi as a NAT point..
where's the AP ?
that's windows.. but i'm not sure on linux..
lookup NAT wifi
problem is this..
you need to have WIFI documented as the WAN interface..
which means.. almost impossible documentation
you can try it.. but treat the WAN wifi interface from documentation as its a LAN interface..
so instead of eth0 mentioned in documentation, think of it as wlan0 or wifi0
google "masquerade debian wiki"
maybe this http://www.google.ca/search?q=masquerade+ubuntu+wiki&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&aq=t&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&client=firefox-a
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Internet/ConnectionSharing
are you using a "cross-over" link rj45 cable? maybe u have to set it up with the driver.. or simply use a cross-over cable if the data-links don't light up
i dont have a crossover cable
i'm not sure if there's an option for cross-over somewhere, it's possible.. but I would use a cross-over cable to make things easier..
